problem.markdown:
>> Which statement is NOT true below?<< ( ) Simulation is used to analyze finite-buffer lines. Simulation can be accurate, but it's statistical, and it can be slowed when doing optimization. ( X ) We can get exact analytical solutions for two-machine, finite-buffer lines. And there are five parameters of two-machine, finite-buffer lines: 1) the probability of machine one failing while doing an operation; 2) the probability of machine one getting repaired during an operation time when it is down; 3) the probability of machine two failing while doing an operation; 4) the probability of machine two getting repaired during an operation time when it is down; 5) time elapsed. ( ) If we increase the buffer size and leave other parameters the same of two-machine, finite-buffer lines, the production rate will be only slightly increased, and the average inventory will increase by the amount close to the increased buffer size.
[explanation] The last parameter should be the number of parts of the buffer can hold. The time elapsed is not a parameter of the flow line itself. It is the horizontal axis of the simulation graph. [explanation]

multiplechoiceresponse.label: Which statement is NOT true below?

choicegroup.choice: Simulation is used to analyze finite-buffer lines. Simulation can be accurate, but it's statistical, and it can be slowed when doing optimization.

We can get exact analytical solutions for two-machine, finite-buffer lines. And there are five parameters of two-machine, finite-buffer lines: 1) the probability of machine one failing while doing an operation; 2) the probability of machine one getting repaired during an operation time when it is down; 3) the probability of machine two failing while doing an operation; 4) the probability of machine two getting repaired during an operation time when it is down; 5) time elapsed.

If we increase the buffer size and leave other parameters the same of two-machine, finite-buffer lines, the production rate will be only slightly increased, and the average inventory will increase by the amount close to the increased buffer size.

div.p: The last parameter should be the number of parts of the buffer can hold. The time elapsed is not a parameter of the flow line itself. It is the horizontal axis of the simulation graph.
